servinfo.title: DTC P2128: Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit High Input

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P2122: Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low Input .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is more than specified value for 0.5 seconds continuously.

item.ptxt: Incorrect mounting of accelerator (APP) sensor assembly

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Keep the accelerator pedal at idle position for 2 seconds.
Keep the accelerator pedal at fully depressed position for 2 seconds.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly mounting check

test1.ptxt: Check that accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly has been mounted to vehicle body properly (no pinched floor carpet, etc).

testgroup.question: Is it OK?

action.ptxt: Reinstall accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly properly referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Removal and Installation .

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch, check “APP Sensor 2 Volt” displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Is displayed voltage 4.8 V or more?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly at “ORN/BLU”, “BLU/GRN” and “BLU/YEL” wire terminals.
If OK, measure voltage between “ORN/BLU” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.
Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-53” terminal.
If OK, measure voltage between “E23-53” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
“ORN/BLU” wire is shorted to power circuit.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-56”, “E23-53” and “E23-52” terminals.
If OK, measure resistance between “BLU/GRN” wire terminal and each “WHT”, “ORN/BLU” wire terminals of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector.

action.ptxt: “BLU/GRN” wire is shorted to “WHT” wire and/or “ORN/BLU” wire.

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “E23-52” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: “BLU/GRN” wire is shorted to power circuit.

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly check

test1.ptxt: Check accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is output voltage within specified value?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Replace accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly.
